sub_topic: Finding the area of a sector of a circle.
message_1: A circle has a radius of 8 cm. Calculate the area of a sector of the circle if its central angle measures 60 degrees.
message_2:
To calculate the area of a sector of a circle, we can use the formula:

Area of sector = (Central angle in degrees / 360) × π × r²

where r is the radius of the circle.

Given, the radius of the circle (r) is 8 cm and the central angle is 60 degrees. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Area of sector = (60 / 360) × π × 8²
Area of sector = (1/6) × π × 64
Area of sector = 64π/6

Simplifying the fraction, we get:

Area of sector = 32π/3

So, the area of the sector is (32π/3) cm².
